message: If I have a site built with HTML , CSS and JS. What are my options for storing and reading data ? I want to host it on Github Pages so I don't wanna use server side code to avoid the need for a server. Is using JSON the best way ? Are there alternative options ?

data.message: just some categories such that each category has about 10 links and users can add links and all the categories are shown to all users and users can search for categories too. So reading and storing data are needed.
I did it once using Parse.com
HTML5 comes with browser based storage, supported by many browsers, I guess with max storage of 4 GB..The new cookies if I can say

you can read data without server side code using the XML or any other way  but i doubt if you can add or edit
 if there is someone knows a way to add and edit without using server side code please correct me
Amr Eldib Omar Sabet Would it be proper with writing / updating too ?
Ahmed Kamal Writing to the server using the client side only is not possible, there has to be some server side script to handle this, which is not available in case of gh pages
so there is no way to perform writing and updating without using server side code right ?
Json, u cant go 2 the server if u r nt doing some asp.net thing for example without the js family
Thanks a lot for all your answers :)

Ahmed Kamal There are some workarounds though, as I mentioned before, we had this problem while creating the group archive, one solution was to use parse.com api to upload data to their flat database and retrieve it as json, both could be done easily from javascript
